quest.name: Securing the Saltery
journal: Nanamo is ready to move ahead with her plans.
objectives: Speak with Lyse in the Ala Mhigan Quarter.
Speak with Wiscar and use the telescope to observe a yabby.
Speak with Wiscar and use the telescope to observe a phoebad.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Our course is decided. I shall return to the palace and have my ministers begin work on implementing the particulars of the plan.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: If I could prevail upon you one more time, Forename, I would ask that you convey the details of our negotiations to Commander Hext on your return to Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: My thanks again. Together, we have laid the groundwork for an endeavor which promises to benefit the peoples of Ala Mhigo and Ul'dah both.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: You need not accompany me back to the palace─I will have Papashan arrange an escort. That is, if he hasn't already organized a search party... I've been absent for rather longer than intended...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. How was your audience with the sultana?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: In your absence, I have kept myself busy cataloging the riches of the mad king's trove and calculating its worth in gil. I have some way to go, but the figure is already quite staggering.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Oh, uh...greetings, Forename! I'm actually in the middle of reporting to the commander here, so...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Forename! You're back! What did Nanamo─ Oh! Sorry... Are you allowed to talk about your audience with the sultana?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So...Raubahn says he's going to return to Ul'dah...but she isn't sure he wants to.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Hmph. Tell us something we don't know... But I'm pleased to hear she's committed to helping our refugees come home.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And this plan to revitalize the Saltery does make a lot of sense. Quite how you convinced her to seek Lolorito's help is another question. After all that has happened, he is the very last person I would expect her to turn to for advice.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But on a more practical note─Lyse, assuming the interim government elects to accept Ul'dah's proposal, I have one caveat I should like you to include in the bargain.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ala Mhigo must be permitted to cover a portion of the investment. We have a fortune at our disposal, after all, and allowing Ul'dah to provide the entirety of the capital will afford Lolorito too much control.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Honestly, Alphinaud─it's like Kugane never happened. What exactly does a ruthless profiteer have to do to earn your trust?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: But yes, you do make a good point. First things first, though, we need to discuss this proposal with the Saltery's residents.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Wiscar─how do you fancy explaining the sultana's plan to your grandfather? I'd like to hear what Watt thinks of the idea before agreeing to anything.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Right away, Commander. Would you mind coming along, Forename? I might need you to fill in the details.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then I shall come as well. Should Watt wish to discuss figures, my knowledge of the nation's finances may prove useful.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I'm leaving the business of dividing up the treasure to those who know about such things. I'm not proud to admit it, but every time I see a column of numbers, my eyes glaze over. One of these days, I'll have to ask Alphinaud to explain it all to me...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I'll have to give Nanamo my thanks next time we meet. With this and everything else that's been happening, it really feels like things are gathering pace around here.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ideally, one would want Ala Mhigo's stake to match Ul'dah's gil for gil... In combination with a cast-iron contract, that should serve to prevent Lolorito from making off with all of the profits...

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Let's go and see Grandad! He's going to want to hear this!

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: What manner of mischief brings you young'uns to old Watt this time, eh?

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: They want to rebuild the Saltery, Grandad! Forename, tell him about the deal!

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: Well bugger me... We've never had the coin or the hands to put the place back to how it was─but it sounds like that's about to change!

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: ...There's just one small wrinkle in your plan: it doesn't account for all the nasties queuing up to eat anyone who goes near the shore.

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: The king used to send soldiers to cull the buggers, but the imperials weren't about to help the likes of us.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Don't worry, Grandad─we'll take care of all that. Commander Hext has been talking about starting up regular patrols, and I'm sure she'd assign me to the loch if I asked.

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: I'd appreciate that, Wiscar, my lad, truly I would. So, does this mean you've gotten better with that blade of yours?

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: I've been training, aye...but mostly to kill imperials.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: You've some experience hunting monsters, don't you, Forename? Think you could cast an eye over a few of the local beasties and teach me how to deal with 'em?

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Let's not waste any time, then! I'll see you by the loch!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Whilst you are busy attending to the local fauna, I shall have Master Watt explain to me exactly what is required to restore the Saltery to its former glory. Good hunting!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Needless to say, I shall impress upon our friend here the singular importance of securing a fair contract with his Ul'dahn benefactors.

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: It does my heart good to see youngsters like my grandson giving their all to rebuild the country. Feels like anything's possible.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Right then, Forename. I've got a spyglass here you can use to take a closer look at these pests. Once you've got their measure, you can tell me what to do, and we'll see how well I get on!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search your surroundings for yabbies. You may move the camera as well as zoom in and out. Target a yabby and inspect it with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The yabby's entire body is protected by a hard carapace, but the underside of the head looks soft and vulnerable.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Ah, looks like you've found a yabby. They say hitting their shell's like smacking a rock. Any suggestions?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What's the best way to defeat a yabby?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Aim for the soft underside of the head!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Just hit it as hard as you can!

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Vulnerable under the head, are they? R-Right then! Wish me luck!

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: I... All right, then. I was hoping there'd be more of a trick to it, but brute force it is!

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Thanks, Forename. I did just as you told me and the wavekin went down like a sack of popotoes! Let's find something else!

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: I think I can handle the yabbies now, so we should try something different. What else is out there...?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search your surroundings for phoebads. You may move the camera as well as zoom in and out. Target a phoebad and inspect it with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The phoebad's hands are large and powerful, but destroying its crystallized core should render the salt golem inanimate. You sense power pulsating from behind its brow.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Ugh...a phoebad. How do I defeat one of those?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: How should Wiscar defeat the phoebad?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Destroy the core within its brow!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Just hit it really, really hard! As hard as you can!

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Inside its head, is it? I'll try to stab it right between the eyes, then!

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: As hard...as I can. Well, simple strategies are often the best! Here goes!

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text:
<pant> <pant>
It's not easy...fighting with the liberator of Ala Mhigo watching your every...move. But I got the job done.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Thanks for the advice, Forename! I feel a lot better prepared for my patrols now.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Anyroad, we should head back to the Saltery before Grandad starts to worry I've been snipped into pieces and fed to a yabby's hatchlings.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Let's hurry up and tell Grandad how the hunt went. It'll set his mind at ease.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: For the merchants of Ul'dah, a well-constructed contract is both sword and shield, and Watt must understand this if we are to meet them on an even field. Speaking of battles, does Wiscar seem equal to the task of thinning the loch's monster population? He certainly seemed eager enough.

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: I see you've returned in one piece. Dealt with those beasties then, did you?

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Aye, fought them myself...after a bit of instruction from Forename here, like. Once I've shared what I've learned with the others, we should have no trouble keeping the shoreline clear.

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: Good lad. A fine young man you've become, Wiscar. A fine young man, indeed.

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: Too often of late, I hear tales of folk over in the city, drunk on victory and hungry for revenge, their heads stuck firmly in the past.

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: But we need to set our sights on the future─on things which'll improve our lot. Things like getting the Saltery ready to welcome our long-lost countrymen.
